channel.title: Command
channel.description: hey i was wondering how to make one of those pages pop up when ppl type ::commands muchly appreciated if u cud tell me :D

item.title: Command
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“bballin24, post:12, topic:319819”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=416274.msg3061935#msg3061935 date=1260921636]

I found it funny how people often help the person out after somebody else had already posted a decent solution, even when it would have worked in both cases.
Just saying.

Sorry, I like being organized and creating a method for things I might call multiple times rather than have that whole blob every single time I want to show the interface.
[/quote]

umm where do i put the first code in client.class help please[/quote]
Under:

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

Should be near the top.

Read full topic

item.title: Command
item.dc:creator: @bballin24 bballin24
item.description:
@bballin24 wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:8, topic:319819”]Client class. Declare:

public void commandHelp() { sendQuest("String", #); }

where in client.class do i put this ?! well the first code ???

Call the method:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) { commandHelp(); }

The command should be added under the customCommand method.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Command
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Client class. Declare:

public void commandHelp() { sendQuest("String", #); }

Call the method:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) { commandHelp(); }

The command should be added under the customCommand method.

Read full topic

item.title: Command
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

Search for customCommand in client.java

The command goes right under that.

item.title: Command
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) { sendQuest("THIS IS WHERE THE TITLE GOES", 8144); clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("BODY TEXT", 8148); sendQuest("BODY TEXT", 8149); sendQuest("BODY TEXT", 8150); sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); }

See the 3 lines that contain BODY TEXT?
These lines can be repeated, but the 4-digit number at the end has to be one higher then the last (The first one on the list has to be 8148)
I’m not sure how high it goes, but I have some pretty big lists.

Read full topic
